lfs_fuse moduleÂ¶

The main function in lfs_fuse.pyx is

cdef int cmain(int argc, char **argv)

The key part is cdef fuse_lowlevel_ops ops. fuse_lowlevel_ops is part of the FUSE library, that will be used to handle the request from the kernel and invoke the corresponding methods in the FUSE file system implementation. More details see To FUSE or Not to FUSE paper.

Here, we regesiter our FUSE file system implementation with the low-level API interface:

ops.getattr = &ll_getattr
ops.lookup = &ll_lookup
ops.readdir = &ll_readdir
ops.mknod = &ll_mknod

For example, if FUSE library receives the getattr request from the kernel, which sent by the user application, corresponding ll_getattr method will be invoked.

cdef void ll_getattr(fuse_req_t req, fuse_ino_t ino, fuse_file_info *fi)

mkstat is invoked.

cdef int mkstat(fuse_ino_t ino, struct_stat *stbuf)

Inside stat = inode_obj.get_attr(ino), get_attr() is invoked, which comes from lfs.py.
